bill_title: establish a website for the posting of notices for certain local governments.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to establish a website for the posting of notices for certain local governments. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That a NEW SECTION be added: 17-5-1. Definitions. Terms used in this Act mean: (1) "Meeting information," a local government's agendas, final minutes as approved by the local government's governing body, and, if available, links to any audio or video live stream or archive; (2) "Local government," all municipalities, counties, and school districts. Section 2. That a NEW SECTION be added: 17-5-2. Website--Public information. The Bureau of Administration shall create and maintain a publicly searchable internet website for the uniform posting and access of the meeting information of local governments. Section 3. That a NEW SECTION be added: 17-5-3. Posting--Requirements. Local governments shall provide and post all meeting information on the website created under § 17-5-2. Local governments shall continue to post meeting information as required by chapter 1-25. Section 4. That a NEW SECTION be added: 17-5-4. Posting--Deadlines. If any deadline to post the meeting information via any medium exists in any other law, that deadline applies to the posting of meeting information on the website created under § 17-5-2. In all cases, the postings required under any other law are the official postings for all legal purposes. Section 5. That a NEW SECTION be added: 17-5-5. Subscriptions--Electronic notice. The website shall provide an option to subscribe to receive email notices when a local government posts meeting information to the website created under § 17-5-2. The website shall contain a link to the official website of the local government entity, if one exists, with a notice that the official local website should be consulted for any changes after the initial posting. Section 6. That a NEW SECTION be added: 17-5-6. Public data--Archive. All past and archived public information required to be posted by a local government under this Act shall be available for the public to search and view on the website. Section 7. That a NEW SECTION be added: 17-5-7. Notice and information--Compliance. The Bureau of Administration shall provide for notice of the provisions and requirements of this Act to each local government that is subject to this Act. Section 8. That a NEW SECTION be added: 17-5-8. Promulgation--Rules. The Bureau of Administration may promulgate rules, pursuant to chapter 1-26, to: (1) Create and maintain a website under § 17-5-2; (2) Create a list of meeting information that is required to post under § 17-5-3; (3) Establish requirements regarding the archiving of public data under § 17-5-6; and (4) Establish any training or materials necessary to implement § 17-5-7. Section 9. This Act is effective on July 1, 2022.
